p: With the ABTS and DPPH methods, the antioxidant activity obtained was weak. For the essential oils, the weak antioxidant activity in the DPPH assay can be explained by the fact that terpene compounds are not capable of donating a hydrogen atom, and by the low solubility provided by them in the reaction medium of the assay, because this test utilizes methanol as a solvent [ 35]. The weak in vitro antioxidant activity of essential oils from D. peruviana mainly consisting of monoterpene with proven antioxidant activity, such as Î±-phellandrene [ 22] and limonene [ 36], may be due to antagonism with other compounds present in essential oil.
